description: The regulation of health products is vital to protecting public health, by ensuring that these products are of the expected safety, quality and efficacy/performance. This module provides an overview of the regulatory ecosystem and defines the roles and responsibilities of a regulatory professional. It describes the different functions and desired qualities of a regulatory system, including Good Regulatory Practices. It emphasizes evidence-based quality decision-making by highlighting the key established international good practice guidelines. Students will learn about integrated approaches to product life cycle management and regulatory control. They will also learn about key regional regulatory networks and current regulatory challenges.
title: Foundations of Health Product Regulation
